page.title: 03Village Stores:The Deverills
page.content: The{Post Office Stores}at{Longbridge {Deverill}is 25 years old and is a purpose-built shop, with a Post Office at the rear and a house attached .The original shop stood some 25 metres away and was pulled down to make way for road improvements to the A350 and its crossroads. The shop is a{general {stores}and{Post Office,}and an {Off-licence.}It sells newspapers and magazines,dairy products,frozen foods and ice-creams, groceries,toiletries, sweets and drinks even knitting wool and wellingtons.It also provides services,shoe repairs and dry cleaning On an average day they serve about 160 customers,many of them passing motorists,the shop has its own layby on the busy A350.There is a delivery service for groceries and newspapers to Crockerton, Hill and Brixton Deverill and Rye Hill.
